items.content:
Data Integration Engineer - 1 days telecommute!

Exciting opportunity for an Integration Engineer to join an award winning software company in the healthcare industry!

This is a hands-on role where you will be responsible for developing, enhancing, and supporting new and existing products. The position will support and build new integrations between our software product and other external systems. Additionally, you will be responsible for working with the development team to build new applications and ensure solid technical design, coding, testing and deployment of integrations.

Enjoy this direct-hire position in Dunwoody that offers flexible work hours and 1-2 days telecommute after 90 day review! Don't miss out on working with a fun, high energy and collaborative team, with the opportunity to truly make an impact and grow your career!

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:

  • 3+ years experience with API integrations
  • Exposure to or light experience with with integration of server side C# for the .NET API layer
  • XML, JSON, SQL
  • Networking and authentication methodologies

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:

  • HL7 and FHIR formats, parsers and structures
  • WCF
  • Mirth Connect
  • Jira or Atlassian

Must be authorized to work in the U.S./Sponsorships are not available

items.title: SOA Integration Engineer (REMOTE)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=2, c=0, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content: Position Sr. SOA Integration Engineer Location Los Angeles, CA Duration 12+ Months Job Description The Sr. SOA Integration Engineer designs and builds LA Care's SOA integration solutions as part of the Enterprise Integration Services team, working with the architecture, business, application and IT infrastructure teams. The Sr. SOA Integration Engineer will analyse business and technical problems and develop the appropriate the SOABPELBAM framework to incorporate Master Data, event driven and batch processing entities to the master service bus. The ideal candidate would be an excellent communicator and relationship builder, with the ability to discuss and understand HealthCare business partners across all operations. This person must be well organized, flexible, motivated and enjoy the challenges of supporting a complex, changing environment, with attention to detail, at times under pressure, remaining flexible, proactive, resourceful and efficient. The ideal candidate will build relationships throughout business units, our customers, and their teams to ensure that the services provided are of exceptional quality. Standard Duties and Responsibilities Develops SOA integration and Business Workflow detailed design and code to meet the business needs of the company by working closely with key architects, stakeholders and partners. Supports in-house project teams to implement SOA integration solutions. Leads both onsite and offshore engineers when needed. Provides technical guidance to various departments. Works closely with development teams to ensure compliance with LAC architecture guidelines and engineering standards. Supports and creates detailed design documents, process documents, standards documents and governance documents. Collaborates with enterprise architects across the organization on the details of the systems architecture for their particular domain. Works closely with IT Solutions Delivery areas to identify and resolve integration and workflow considerations and issues. Delivers solutions on schedule and provides accurate work estimates for work assignments. Assists with POC s for overall system design and architecture validity. Integrates IT Solutions into a common SOABPELBAM bus framework. Follows and enforces standards around systems technology stacks and mechanisms for governing cloud-based infrastructure. Preferred Degree Master s Degree Required Major Bachelor s Degree in Computer Science, Business Adm. or related field Major Bachelor s Degree in Business I.T. or related field Years of DirectRelevant Experience Required 7 to 10 years of experience Describe the types of previous job experience required 10 years of experience in design and implementation of ORACLEPLSQL andor SQL Server Batch processes. 7 years of experience writing JAVA applications. 5 years of experience designing and building solutions with ORACLE SOA suite 12c (ESBBPELSOABAM). Strong experience of leading advanced technical resources. Strong understanding of process and queuing design patterns. Excellent writing skills. Demonstrated experience designing and building enterprise level canonical models. Experience in multiple database platforms, including NoSQL, SQL Server and Oracle. Experience working with end users to understand requirements, high level designs and build technical solutions from concept to implementation. Previous healthcare experience is preferred. Strong problem-solving and analytical ability. Thanks, Ram Chapala Mythri Consulting LLC.

items.title: Integration Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=18, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Integration Engineer at Dragos

Remote
  • REMOTE
  • ENGINEERING
  • FULL-TIME

Do you want to make a meaningful contribution to society by securing critical infrastructure and knowing that your work was impactful? Our software codifies our knowledge and experience, delivering an intelligent, orchestrated, and automated approach to asset protection, threat detection, analysis, and response. The Dragos Platform is not just an application we sell to our customers, it is the solution that our Threat Operations Center (TOC) uses; a scalable tool able to protect the most sophisticated ICS infrastructures.

Dragos is looking for a self-motivated and enthusiastic software engineer interested in developing solutions to help safeguard the world’s industrial infrastructure in a highly collaborative team at Dragos. We set our goal as best in class and are looking for team players who set these same standards for themselves.

Responsibilities

  • Design and build robust, high-volume, low-latency applications for interacting with 3rd party applications, extending functionality of the Dragos Platform and partner applications.
  • Write well-designed, testable, and efficient code
  • Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle
  • Prepare and produce releases of software components
  • Support continuous improvement by investigating and presenting alternative technologies for team review

Requirements

  • 3-5 years of hands-on experience with Python, Flask, and Django
  • Experience building and interacting with REST APIs.
  • Experience building highly-scalable, concurrent, large-volume applications
  • Experience with microservice system architecture and design patterns
  • Experience with enterprise message Queues such as AQMP, MQTT, Kafka, etc.
  • Experience configuring IP based networks and Software Defined Networking (SDN) is a plus
  • Ability to understand and design how multiple systems can interact to improve functionality in the entire ecosystem
  • Ability to work collaboratively with the team to brainstorm solutions
  • Ability to multitask on several complex programming assignments while simultaneously balancing multiple deadlines and priorities
  • Knowledge of software development principles and design patterns
  • Personal initiative, self-motivation, and results-oriented work ethic and ability to work independently with minimal supervision

Dragos seeks passionate, hard-working, fun-loving, small-ego, big-brained people. Our tagline is “Safeguarding Civilization” not because we think highly of ourselves, but because the problems we are solving are critically important, today and in the years to come. We look for ICS experts across industries who are committed to growing global expertise in the space by training the next wave of future innovators and thought leaders. We offer competitive salary, equity, full benefits (medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance-all 100% covered) and 6% match-401K.

Dragos is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce. Come join us! Come join us!

Apply for job

items.title: TaxJar: Integration Partner Manager

hiringOrganization.name: HotjarFull-TimeEMEATelemetryTVFull-TimeOn the planet Earth. HealthifyFull-TimeEast Coast

items.content:
Integration Partner Manager

TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 15,000 businesses. Our mission is to make ecommerce easier for everyone.

Our core values

  • We do the right thing for our customers.
  • We're a team, built on trust.
  • We're proud to be remote.
  • We're in control of our own destiny.

TaxJar’s remote-only team of 90+ people is growing fast. We’re currently looking for an Integration Partner Manager who wants to make a difference on a growing, experienced team of entrepreneurs.

*This is a full-time remote position based in the US only.

REQUIREMENTS

As an Integration Partner Manager you will

  • Coordinate and manage the implementation and onboarding of integration partners
  • Act as liaison between integration partners and TaxJar’s platform integrations team, managing integration review and certification process
  • First level escalation contact for integration partners and internal departments with questions related to integrations
  • Support analysis/business reviews for partner optimization and yield improvement
  • Develop ad hoc reporting as needed per internal and external requests
  • Collaborate directly with our partnership team to identify, streamline, and support all go-to-market initiatives to develop and execute a revenue generating partnership based off partner tier and scope we see for each integration partner
  • Automate partner tiering process with TaxJar’s partner portal with access to joint content, sales enablement tools, joint campaign material, and onboarding activities for our partners
  • Lead partner marketing activities to meet quota attainment and strategic company objectives. Collaborate with sales to review sales metrics for partnership QBR’s and tiering assessments
  • Evaluate the ROI of partner marketing activities and recommend actions to improve lead generation and quality to drive leads to opportunities
  • Creation and updating of messaging for solutions tailored to fit each integration partner (integration options, market differentiations from competition, size of addressable markets, etc.)
  • Manage and track spending, lead generation, and ROI for the partner activities and campaign performance
  • Identify industry events to drive partner development through messaging and brand awareness (user groups, associations, industry meet-ups)
  • Create and/or seek opportunities to execute on joint webinars through integration partnerships to drive messaging through the channel
  • Collaborate with internal teams to best train our employees about our integration partnerships, messaging, product functionality, marketing assets available, and joint marketing activities

You have

  • A Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing or related field
  • Organizational and self-management ability – Must be able to independently manage several projects at once
  • Outstanding organizational and time management skills; analytical background
  • Project management skills preferred to monitor projects and keep them on track
  • Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations
  • Must possess exceptional problem-solving, analytical, and research skills
  • Able to make independent choices and recommendations without immediate supervision
  • Travel and participation in events and after-hours meetings with partners as required

You’ll be a great fit for TaxJar if you

  • Only want to work remotely
  • Are a PRO at communicating and collaboration
  • Highly value working with people you like and respect
  • Are accountable
  • Are confident in your skills and a solid team player (We’re peers here, no egos please) but also comfortable working asynchronously
  • Hungry to play an impactful role and not afraid to fail

We’re a happy team and we all really love what we do. We've created a space where high-achievers can succeed, but are also safe to fail. We're profitable and focused on growing TaxJar sustainably. We're always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. We’re always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.

BENEFITS

  • Excellent health, vision and dental benefits
  • Flexible vacation policy
  • 401k plan
  • $1,000 in professional development credit
  • Home office stipend
  • Equity in a profitable company
  • 2x year all-company in person retreats (fully paid for by us of course)
  • Mandatory Birthday holiday!
  • 12 week paid maternity / 6 week paid paternity leave
  • Monthly perks reimbursement for things like Netflix, Amazon Prime, your gym membership, home internet and more.

We offer all of our employees amazing benefits. Visit www.TaxJar.com/jobs for a full list of our benefits and to learn more about how we work and what we stand for.

If you're not the perfect fit for this position, but you know someone who is, we'll pay you $1,000 if you refer us to the person we hire.

items.title: Hopper HQ - Senior sysadmin and automation developer

items.content:
Hopper HQ, a leading social media management tool, is looking for an experienced Senior Sysadmin & Automation engineer to lead on their unique physical and virtual mobile infrastructure.

The right candidate should have the ability to own and manage a unique mix of virtual and physical devices, including provisioning new devices around the world, to take their stack to the next level.

The perfect team member would have 5+ years of Linux sysadmin experience, knowledge in managing both cloud-based infrastructure and non-traditional devices, have a proven history with *nix networking, and be fluent in Python with a knowledge of debugging Android.

In addition to searching for someone technically excellent, Hopper HQ is excited to welcome a new member into their close knit, passionate and entrepreneurial team. With a strong focus on creating excellent products and customer value. Hopper HQ is part of Turn Partners, the UK based startup studio as such the right person will have close proximity to multiple other exciting projects.

The role offers a competitive salary with numerous benefits including optional remote working, unlimited holiday, team travels, a great working environment along with personal and professional development.

Please register your interest on the email provided and to receive the link to the application form.

We look forward to hearing from you.

items.content:
This is a fully remote role, we will consider applicants based in Europe.

About the Role

As part of the Automation Team you will be crucial in facilitating and implementing internal automation requests within Client Services. Help manage and develop a variety of applications interacting with the tools CS agents use daily. You will be working with established RESTful API endpoints to improve the experience for our hard working support team, using the latest development standards.

What you'll do:

  • Develop automation projects to assist with Client Services existing tools
  • Design and maintain internal applications through the full development life cycle
  • Research and analyze complex requests to find the best automation solution
  • Translate ideas into practical automation applications
  • Maintain a well organized codebase

You are:

  • Proficient in JavaScript and ES2015 - 2017
  • Experienced with Node JS and Restful API's
  • Accomplished in writing concise, readable and testable code
  • Passionate about automation with 1-2 years experience in a similar role
  • Well versed in basic security best practices

Nice to Haves

  • Experience with PHP
  • Experience integrating multiple data sources
  • Experience with Google Scripts
  • Knowledge of Docker
  • Experience with React/Angular frameworks

 

What's it in for you?

Unparalleled industry training. A place in a growing, supportive team where you’ll be encouraged to bring fresh ideas to the table.

Collaboration with an international, thriving remote community filled with dreamers and doers. The opportunity to work with one of the fastest growing and largest digital asset exchanges in the world. Competitive salary, perks, benefits and culture

 

Check out all our open roles at https://jobs.lever.co/kraken. We’re excited to see what you’re made of.  

We’re powered by people from around the world with their own unique backgrounds and experiences. We value all Krakenites and their talents, contributions, and perspectives.

items.content:
Building a Trello like page

Company: Outsource Experts Ltd.
Location: Remote
Job type: Freelance
Salary: USD 30-70
Skills:
  • #vue
  • Bootstrap 4
  • Ruby on Rails
  • Webpack

    • Company description

    Providing photo editing services to ecommerce and product photography businesses.

    Job description

    Hello,

    We're developing an app using Ruby on Rails. On that app, we need to develop a page similar to a Trello board, with lists and tasks that can be moved etc.

    We've the workspace in c9, where webpacker has been configured, you'll be developing this new page there.

    Bootstrap theme is being used for this app, and complete html of UI design will be provided, so you don't have to bother about the styling but just focus on the Vue.

    Candidates with expertise on Rails will get priority so that the server side processing can be done at the same time as the front-end. However, some of the complex server side processing are already complete so there will be least amount of work on server side/RoR.

    We'll need around 20 hours of work per week, in the first couple of weeks, with possibility to continue on other parts of the app but possibly on reduced hours. But you'll be working remotely.

    We're willing to pay around $50 per hour, but please let us know your rate for better consideration.

    Apply now!

items.title: Senior React.js Engineer - join us to build tools for other developers
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)

items.content:
Senior React.js Engineer - join us to build tools for other developers

Load Impact Engineers build next-generation, performance testing tools for other developers and DevOps engineers. Our open-source load testing platform,  is at the forefront of innovation in performance testing space. It is one of the trending projects on , with over 5k stars.

We embrace open source, and publish most of our “secret sauce” on GitHub, for developers to review, edit and improve!

Recently we have made a decision to transition our app from Ember.js to React.js. As a react engineer you will be part of the team responsible for architecting and developing our single page app that serves thousands of our customers every day on . Since we are currently in a growth phase with an exciting roadmap ahead of us, you will contribute to the design and implementation of several new major features. 

As a Software Engineer, you will work in a small team and have the ability to switch your role to Python/Go backend, UX, or even DevOps to keep things interesting. Load Impact is growing, and we encourage our engineers to grow with the company and learn new technologies as the company expands. This is not a job where you do the same thing every day.

We need your react expertise to expand the functionality and scale the service to match customer's expectations. 

Due to our small teams and fast development pace, you will have a substantial and immediate impact on how the end product is architected, developed, and how the engineering team operates. Most importantly, you will work with competent colleagues and will be able to expand your knowledge and skills in different directions.

Skills and requirements

Expected:

  • You are best in class frontend engineer, or on your way there
  • Solid experience with single page apps connecting to REST/APIs services
  • Solid experience with react.js.
  • Attention to details, and passion for quality
  • Be well versed in ES6 and modern CSS

It’s an advantage if you:

  • have an interest in developing your backend skills
  • have experience with WebSockets
  • have interest or experience in performance investigations and load testing
  • have experience in data analyzing, and presenting charts, trends, etc.

Responsibilities

  • Develop our new single page app based on the React.js, interfacing with our REST API.
  • Maintain a scalable and modular CSS architecture
  • Collaborate with the design/product team on improving user experience
  • Develop our test suite to make sure it keeps an even pace with the development of the app

Interview process

  1. Apply via this form. If you don’t have a ready CV, send us a short intro with a link to your GitHub account, if that’s quicker
  2. We do a first-pass screening
  3. We’ll either ask you to do a code assignment (on your own time) or you can show us one of your existing projects (one that you are proud of)
  4. We hold an interview with you where we talk about the code assignment or one of your projects, as well as ask you additional questions. This will involve 1-2 people from Load Impact
  5. We let you know whether we want to give you an offer and you let us know whether you’re still interested
  6. Success!

We accept remote applications in +/- 3h time difference from the head office in Stockholm. About 50% of us work remotely from Croatia, Serbia, Ukraine, Russia and Bulgaria, the rest of the team is located in Stockholm, Sweden. If you work locally, we expect you to be in the office on Mondays and Wednesdays. You can work remotely for the rest of the week :-)

Recruiting is ongoing. We will respond to your application immediately. If you don’t have a CV ready, don’t create one, send us a link to your Github/LinkedIn with a few sentences about yourself.

Apply now

items.content:
Search - Integrations Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Data & Analytics, Search, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: Public

Reactions to this job

1 0 0 0 0 0
New! How do you feel about this job listing?
Company: Elastic | No office location

Technologies

wordpress
elasticsearch
reactjs
bevacqua Senior Software Engineer at Elastic, and JavaScript Consultant, Speaker, Published Author 28k 41 142 270
tsg 1.8k 9 10
cstrzadala 146 5
drewr 1.4k 14 20

Job description

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. Diversity drives our vibe. We unite employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.

Swiftype is a growing team of talented search engineers with a range of experiences and backgrounds. As an Integrations Engineer at Swiftype, you will take on a variety of responsibilities that will range from building example applications to showcasing the power and flexibility of the Swiftype Search platform. You'll communicate directly with customers in order to intuitively assess their needs, helping them to achieve their search goals while also refining our developer tools and knowledge base. If you see yourself as much a teacher as a coder, this position will be a terrific fit for you.

What You Will Do:

  • Solve Hard Problems
  • Building dashboards in WordPress, Magento, Drupal, Joomla, Shopify, PrestaShop, etc.
  • Code in PHP.
  • Integrate with languages like Ruby, JavaScript, or Python.
  • Work with Git and a command line.
  • Collaborate with the Search engineering team
  • Have a voice.
  • Allow your hard work be displayed and demoed all over the world. 

 What You Bring Along:

  • 2+ years experience as a web developer.
  • Experience building plugins for or customizing WordPress, Magento, Drupal, Joomla, Shopify, PrestaShop, etc.
  • A passion for user experience and crafting intuitive interactions on the web.
  • Experience with JavaScript tooling and libraries, like React, Vue, and jQuery.
  • Experience working with REST/JSON APIs.
  • Experience using browser tools to test, profile, and debug modern web applications.
  • Experience gathering requirements from modern design tools like Figma and Sketch.
  • Experience working with Customer Support and incorporating feedback.
  • Familiarity with Open Source projects and communities.
  • Experience writing technical blog posts and presenting at conferences.

If this sounds interesting, we would love to hear from you. Please include whatever info you believe is relevant: resume, GitHub profile, code examples, links to personal projects, etc.

Additional Information:

We're looking to hire team members invested in realizing the goal of making real-time data exploration easy and available to anyone. As a distributed company, we believe that diversity drives our vibe! Whether you're looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life.

  • Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary
  • Equity
  • Global minimum of 16 weeks of paid in full parental leave (moms & dads)
  • Generous vacation time and one week of volunteer time off
  • Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

Apply now

About Elastic

Elastic builds software to make data usable in real time and at scale for search, logging, security, and analytics use cases. Founded in 2012, the company develops the open source Elastic Stack (Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash), X-Pack (commercial features), and Elastic Cloud (a SaaS offering). To date, there have been more than 100 million cumulative downloads. The Elastic community is 100,000 members strong. Thousands of organizations including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, NASA, Microsoft, Mayo Clinic, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Backed by Benchmark Capital, Index Ventures, and NEA with more than $100 million in funding, Elastic has a distributed workforce with more than 600 employees in 30 countries. Learn more at elastic.co
